name: 6-[bis(5-ethylfuran-2-yl)methyl]-7-nitro-2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2671
Reason: The molecule has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that impact its melting point. The base structure of 2,3-dihydro-1,4-benzodioxine has a melting point of approximately -10.5 degrees Celsius. The nitro group typically raises the melting point by approximately +20 degrees. The ethyl group can increase the melting point by approximately +20 degrees, and the furan ring can contribute to the melting point by approximately +40 degrees. The presence of two nitro groups can also increase the melting point due to their polarity and ability to form hydrogen bonds. The overall impact of these functional groups on the melting point can be estimated as follows: -10.5 (base structure) + 20 (nitro group) + 20 (ethyl group) + 40 (furan ring) + 20 (nitro group) = 100 degrees Celsius.
